data.title: Butler, Montagu Sherard Dawes, Sir, 1873-1952 (Knight, administrator and educationalist)
data.text:
Scope and Contents

Offprint from Obituary Notices of the Royal Society of London, Number 7, Volume 2. Also includes 1 manuscript letter signed from Montagu Butler to W. Campbell Smith thanking him for the appreciation of Hutchinson and 1 manuscript note initialed from Montague Butler sending a copy of the appreciation to the Library.

Scope and Contents

A letter from Delhi written after Butler had returned from a visit to Calcutta. The letter discusses Butler's meeting with Archbishop Foss Westcott, the future of army chaplains, politics, the arrival of Lord Inchcape of the Indian Retrenchment Committee, Butler's resentment at the appointment of Sir Basil Blackett as Finance Member of the Executive Council, and the appointment of Butler's brother, Sir Harcourt Butler, as Governor of Burma.

Conditions Governing Access: From the Fonds: Unless restrictions apply, the collection is open for consultation by researchers using the Manuscripts Reading Room at Cambridge University Library. For further details on conditions governing access please contact mss@lib.cam.ac.uk. Information about opening hours and obtaining a Cambridge University Library reader's ticket is available from the Library's website (www.lib.cam.ac.uk).
